headline.main: Mexico Governor to Be Questioned Over Killing of Photojournalist
headline.print_headline: Mexico Governor to Be Questioned Over Killing of Photojournalist

docs.snippet: The governor of the Mexican state of Veracruz, Javier Duarte, will be questioned over the recent murder of five people in the country's capital, including a photojournalist, the mayor of Mexico City said on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The governor of the Mexican state of Veracruz, Javier Duarte, will be questioned over the recent murder of five people in the country's capital, including a photojournalist, the mayor of Mexico City said on Monday.

headline.main: Rand Paul Compares Donald Trump to ‘the Emperor With No Clothes’

docs.snippet: Lagging in the polls, Senator Rand Paul laid into Donald J. Trump, calling him “a bully” and an “empty suit,” and adding, “Somebody has to challenge him.”...
docs.abstract: Lagging in the polls, Senator Rand Paul laid into Donald J. Trump, calling him “a bully” and an “empty suit,” and adding, “Somebody has to challenge him.”

headline.main: UN: Burundi Violence Spiraling Toward Point of No Return
headline.print_headline: UN: Burundi Violence Spiraling Toward Point of No Return

headline.main: Vintage Toure in the Mood as Man City Begin Impressively
headline.print_headline: Vintage Toure in the Mood as Man City Begin Impressively

docs.snippet: Yaya Toure rekindled memories of the blockbusting performances that helped Manchester City win two Premier League titles in three seasons, scoring twice in an impressive 3-0 victory at West Bromwich Albion on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Yaya Toure rekindled memories of the blockbusting performances that helped Manchester City win two Premier League titles in three seasons, scoring twice in an impressive 3-0 victory at West Bromwich Albion on Monday.

headline.main: Citigroup in $13.5 Million Settlement Over Defunct CSO Hedge Fund
headline.print_headline: Citigroup in $13.5 Million Settlement Over Defunct CSO Hedge Fund

docs.snippet: Citigroup Inc agreed to pay $13.5 million to settle a lawsuit accusing the bank of deceiving investors into remaining in its Corporate Special Opportunities hedge fund, only to suffer big losses when the fund was liquidated in November 2008, court...
docs.lead_paragraph: Citigroup Inc agreed to pay $13.5 million to settle a lawsuit accusing the bank of deceiving investors into remaining in its Corporate Special Opportunities hedge fund, only to suffer big losses when the fund was liquidated in November 2008, court papers filed on Monday show

headline.main: California Man Pleads Guilty to Bid to Support Islamic State
headline.print_headline: California Man Pleads Guilty to Bid to Support Islamic State

docs.snippet: A 21-year-old Southern California man who prosecutors say sought to travel to Syria last year in a bid to join Islamic State fighters pleaded guilty on Monday to federal charges....
docs.lead_paragraph: A 21-year-old Southern California man who prosecutors say sought to travel to Syria last year in a bid to join Islamic State fighters pleaded guilty on Monday to federal charges.

headline.main: From Hemingway to Miles Teller, a Brief History of the Tough Celebrity Profile
headline.print_headline: A Brief History of the Tough Star Profile

docs.snippet: An article on a rising actor is part of a long, if infrequent, tradition of throwing out the usual niceties of the celebrity profile genre....
docs.abstract: Esquire article with actor Miles Teller, in which he appeared to go off-script, is latest in long tradition of celebrities acting out in front of reporter; roundup of several other infamous magazine interviews noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: An article on a rising actor is part of a long, if infrequent, tradition of throwing out the usual niceties of the celebrity profile genre.
